question: What is the primary function of a title block in an aircraft drawing?
explanation: A title block provides details like drawing number, part name, and scale for identification (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 12).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers hydraulic power systems?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 29 covers hydraulic power systems, including pumps and actuators (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 45).

question: What does an orthographic projection show in technical drawings?
explanation: Orthographic projections provide multiple two-dimensional views of an object (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 28).

question: Which drawing type shows the assembly sequence of aircraft parts?
explanation: Assembly drawings illustrate how parts are assembled, including sequence (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 35).

question: What does a tolerance specify in aircraft drawings?
explanation: Tolerances define acceptable dimensional variations for proper fit (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 19).

question: Which tool draws precise circles in drafting?
explanation: A compass is used to draw precise circles and arcs (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 8).

question: What does the Illustrated Parts Catalog (IPC) provide?
explanation: The IPC provides part numbers and diagrams for components (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 52).

question: Which gear converts rotary to linear motion?
explanation: Rack and pinion gears convert rotary to linear motion (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 67).

question: What is the purpose of a sectional view in drawings?
explanation: Sectional views reveal internal structures by cutting through an object (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 31).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers the fuel system?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 28 covers the fuel system, including tanks and pumps (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 48).

question: What does ATA 100 Chapter 21 cover?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 21 covers air conditioning and pressurization (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 40).

question: Which tool is used to measure angles in technical drafting?
explanation: A protractor measures and draws precise angles (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 10).

question: What is the purpose of a detail drawing in aircraft design?
explanation: Detail drawings provide precise dimensions for a single part (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 33).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers electrical power systems?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 24 covers electrical power systems, including generators (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 43).

question: What does a schematic drawing represent?
explanation: Schematic drawings show system connections and flow (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 37).

question: Which tool is used to draw straight lines in drafting?
explanation: A T-square draws precise straight lines (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 9).

question: What is the purpose of the Aircraft Maintenance Manual (AMM)?
explanation: The AMM outlines maintenance and repair procedures (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 55).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers flight controls?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 27 covers flight control systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 46).

question: What does an exploded view drawing show?
explanation: Exploded view drawings show components separated for assembly (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 36).

question: Which tool transfers measurements in drafting?
explanation: Dividers transfer measurements accurately (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 11).

question: What does ATA 100 Chapter 35 cover?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 35 covers oxygen systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 53).

question: What is the purpose of dimension lines in aircraft drawings?
explanation: Dimension lines indicate precise part measurements (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 20).

question: Which drawing type shows electrical system layouts?
explanation: Wiring diagrams show electrical system layouts (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 38).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers landing gear?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 32 covers landing gear systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 50).

question: What is the purpose of a leader line in technical drawings?
explanation: Leader lines connect annotations to specific features (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 21).

question: Which tool draws irregular curves in drafting?
explanation: A French curve draws smooth, irregular curves (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 13).

question: What does the Structural Repair Manual (SRM) provide?
explanation: The SRM provides procedures for structural repairs (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 56).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers pneumatic systems?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 36 covers pneumatic systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 51).

question: What does an isometric drawing show?
explanation: Isometric drawings provide a 3D representation of parts (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 29).

question: Which tool sets precise distances in drafting?
explanation: Dividers set and transfer precise distances (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 11).

question: What does ATA 100 Chapter 24 cover?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 24 covers electrical power systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 43).

question: What is the purpose of a centerline in aircraft drawings?
explanation: Centerlines indicate symmetry or centers of features (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 22).

question: Which drawing type shows internal part details?
explanation: Sectional drawings reveal internal details by cutting through parts (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 31).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers air conditioning?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 21 covers air conditioning systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 40).

question: What is the purpose of a bill of materials in drawings?
explanation: A bill of materials lists all parts for an assembly (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 34).

question: Which tool draws parallel lines in drafting?
explanation: A T-square ensures parallel straight lines (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 9).

question: What does the Component Maintenance Manual (CMM) provide?
explanation: The CMM provides overhaul procedures for components (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 57).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers oxygen systems?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 35 covers oxygen systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 53).

question: What does a phantom line indicate in aircraft drawings?
explanation: Phantom lines show alternate positions or paths (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 23).

question: Which tool creates arcs in technical drafting?
explanation: A compass creates precise arcs and circles (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 8).

question: What does ATA 100 Chapter 27 cover?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 27 covers flight control systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 46).

question: What is the purpose of a hidden line in drawings?
explanation: Hidden lines indicate edges not directly visible (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 24).

question: Which drawing type shows system flow paths?
explanation: Schematic drawings show flow paths for systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 37).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers pneumatic systems?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 36 covers pneumatic systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 51).

question: What is the purpose of a scale in aircraft drawings?
explanation: Scales show proportional sizes between drawing and actual parts (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 15).

question: Which tool draws smooth curves in drafting?
explanation: A French curve draws smooth, irregular curves (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 13).

question: What does the Wiring Diagram Manual (WDM) provide?
explanation: The WDM provides electrical wiring layouts (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 58).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers fuel systems?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 28 covers fuel systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 48).

question: What does a cutting plane line indicate in drawings?
explanation: Cutting plane lines show where a section is cut (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 25).

question: Which tool measures distances in drafting?
explanation: Dividers measure and transfer distances (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 11).

question: What does ATA 100 Chapter 32 cover?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 32 covers landing gear systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 50).

question: What is the purpose of a break line in aircraft drawings?
explanation: Break lines indicate shortened views to fit parts on the drawing (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 26).

question: Which drawing type shows a single part’s specifications?
explanation: Detail drawings provide specifications for a single part (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 33).

question: Which ATA 100 chapter covers flight controls?
explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 27 covers flight control systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 46).

question: What is the purpose of a revision block in drawings?
explanation: A revision block tracks changes to the drawing (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 14).

question: Which tool draws precise angles in drafting?
explanation: A protractor draws and measures precise angles (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 10).

question: What does the Overhaul Manual provide?
explanation: The Overhaul Manual provides component overhaul procedures (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 59).

explanation: ATA 100 Chapter 21 covers air conditioning systems (ET-GC003 Manual, p. 40).
